entry.title: ‘I Didn’t Have to Lie Anymore’—FTX Collapse Was a Relief, Says Caroline Ellison
entry.summary: In a text exchange between Ellison and Sam Bankman-Fried, she told him she was in her "best mood."

entry.title: L’Oréal's New Paris Hub Has an AI 'Visionary Wall'—Here's How it Works
entry.summary: Beauty giant L’Oréal launched a new creative hub in Paris that includes an AI-powered tool for following—and perhaps creating—trends.

entry.title: Yield Generating Stablecoin USDR Loses Peg, Plummets to $0.50
entry.summary: USDR is backed by real estate, and is designed to generate yield for its holders.

entry.title: From Reading X-Rays to Decoding Classified UFO Reports, ChatGPT Shows Off Its Vision
entry.summary: Twitter is abuzz with examples of GPT-4's new visual abilities. Here are some of the best.

entry.title: Despite AI Pushback, MoMA Acquires First Generative AI Artwork
entry.summary: The acquisition of Refik Anadol's work is part of a broader recent push at MoMA to embrace digital art and the blockchain in the long-term.

entry.title: The Trial of Sam Bankman-Fried: Live Blog, Latest News and Insights
entry.summary: FTX founder Sam Bankman-Fried faces seven criminal charges related to the dramatic collapse of his crypto empire. Here's the latest on his trial.

entry.title: Pet3rPan_ on venture DAOs and blockchain games
entry.summary:
Welcome to the 4th episode of this time will be different.
Our guest for today's episode is Pet3rpan_ from Metacartel, 1kx, HydraVentures, and more!
https://twitter.com/pet3rpan_

entry.title: FTX, Thai Prostitutes and Chinese Bribes: Caroline Ellison Drops Explosive Allegations
entry.summary: In her second day taking the stand, Bankman-Fried's ex-girlfriend spoke about an alleged scheme to reclaim frozen funds.

entry.title: Rocket League Players Revolt Over Item Trading Ban—Do NFTs Fix This?
entry.summary: Another closed ecosystem plans to limit how players can use "owned" assets, prompting backlash from Rocket League fans. Do NFTs point the way for gaming?

entry.title: Ethereum Gas Fees Hit New Low for 2023 as DeFi, NFT Activity Drops
entry.summary: With activity waning, Ethereum’s “ultrasound money” meme is under attack as supply is currently growing at an annual inflation of 0.44%.

entry.title: Lido's Arbitrum Proposal Splits Community Over Grant Size, Centralization Concerns
entry.summary: Lido Finance's $4 million ARB grant proposal on Snapshot has become a battleground over the project's purported centralization concerns.

entry.title: What is the Bitcoin Halving? How Bitcoin's Supply is Limited.
entry.summary: Every four years, the amount of Bitcoin awarded to miners is halved, an event known as the Bitcoin halving.

entry.title: Twitter Thread Suggests Sam Bankman-Fried Mulled Shutting Alameda Months Before FTX Collapse
entry.summary: Per a Twitter thread draft, Bankman-Fried called Alameda Research “It was one of my largest successes–and then, briefly, largest failures."

entry.title: Bored Bitcoin Analysts Point to McRib Meme for Bullish Return
entry.summary: The McRib is back and analysts are busy trying to pin Bitcoin and stock performances to the McDonald’s sandwich relaunch.

entry.title: Amazon and Immutable Want to Make it Easier to Launch Crypto Games
entry.summary: Crypto firm Immutable has joined Amazon Web Services' ISV Accelerate Program to develop blockchain gaming infrastructure solutions.

entry.title: BAPE Bets on Virtual Pet Nostalgia With Tamagotchi Streetwear Collab
entry.summary: A Bathing Ape (BAPE) and Bandai’s classic Tamagotchi brand are teaming up for a fashion drop and co-branded virtual pets.

entry.title: Environmental Groups Need to Dig Deeper Into AI Energy Use, Researcher Says
entry.summary: Energy analyst Alex de Vries says limited data is one reason there was a slow response to the emerging threat.

entry.title: As the Halving Approaches, Bitcoin Miner Hut 8 Is Selling Zero BTC
entry.summary: Hut 8 says it is bullish on Bitcoin's long term price, and doesn't need to sell any to finance operations.

entry.title: What is Tezos (XTZ)?
entry.summary: Tezos is a crypto platform that supports smart contracts and Dapps. It also looks to evolve faster than other blockchains.

entry.title: Lightning Network Growth Is a ‘Shock‘, Says Bitcoin Analyst
entry.summary: According to a new report by River Financial, Bitcoin’s layer-2 solution has grown 1,212% over the past two years.

entry.title: Geopolitical Instability Makes Bitcoin a Good Bet, Says Paul Tudor Jones
entry.summary: The billionaire investor continues to praise Bitcoin as a safe haven asset during times of uncertainty.

entry.title: 'We Do Not Speak Your Language': Fashion Brands Signal Crypto Divide in Milan
entry.summary: Milan Fashion Week included prominent examples of fashion giants embracing emerging tech, but also hesitance from some brands.

entry.title: Caroline Ellison: Sam Bankman-Fried Told Me to Take Billions From FTX Customers
entry.summary: In a brief hearing at Bankman-Fried's trial, Caroline Ellison told jurors that Bankman-Fried "directed her to commit crimes."

entry.title: Sony PlayStation 5 Slim Console Revealed—And It's More Expensive
entry.summary: The rumored slim Sony PlayStation 5 is coming in November with tweaks and upgrades, and a higher base price.

entry.title: Trader Joe’s Wants All Profits in Trademark Lawsuit Against Trader Joe DeFi Platform
entry.summary: Grocery store chain Trader Joe's is once again attempting to shut down the similarly-named DeFi platform, after failing to last year.

entry.title: Ethereum DeFi Exchange AirSwap Rolls Out NFT Marketplace
entry.summary: The DEX is marking its sixth anniversary with upgrades across its peer-to-peer crypto platform.

entry.title: First Look: Nintendo's Animal Crossing Gets the Lego Treatment
entry.summary: Five Lego Animal Crossing sets are launching in 2024, starring some of the Nintendo game’s best-known characters.

entry.title: Sam Bankman-Fried's Defense Seeks Details of Co-Founder's Alameda Loan Deals
entry.summary: Bankman-Fried's legal team wants to know to what extent Wang's legal advice influenced his signing off on loans with Alameda Research.

entry.title: 5 Key Technologies Streamlining the Crypto User Experience
entry.summary: These new technologies are helping to overcome blockchain’s early UX challenges and onboard new users to crypto, DeFi and Web3.

entry.title: Israel Authorities Freeze Hamas-Linked Crypto Accounts on Binance
entry.summary: Israeli authorities, in coordination with the crypto exchange Binance, froze accounts suspected with suspected links to Hamas.

entry.title: Tezos Jumps 7% on South Korean Volume Spike, Futures Liquidations
entry.summary: The 24-hour trading volume for Tezos' native token XTZ jumped more than seven times its monthly average amid the latest rally.

entry.title: Layer-2 Blockchains Host Most Ethereum Transactions: Messari
entry.summary: The explosive launch of Base and the virality of friend.tech are behind the latest numbers, says analyst Kunal Goel.

entry.title: Enlisting AI in Medicine and Longevity Research Will Be a ‘Net Positive’: Microsoft VP
entry.summary: Computer scientist Peter Lee said GPT-4 helped restore ‘family harmony’ in healthcare conversations.

entry.title: CrypToadz NFT Sells for $1.6 Million in Ethereum Linked to Tornado Cash
entry.summary: A painful “fat finger” mistake—or obvious money laundering? This seven-figure CrypToadz NFT purchase has sparked fierce speculation.

entry.title: Dating App Tool Upgraded with AI Is Poised to Power Catfishing
entry.summary: Avast calls out an old tool that's learned new tricks, using AI to get even better at running romantic scams on dating apps.

entry.title: Rage Quit? Unity CEO Departs After New Fees Pissed Off Game Developers
entry.summary: Last month, Unity announced a "runtime fee" set to start in 2024, enraging developers. Now, longtime CEO John Riccitiello is leaving.

entry.title: Sam Bankman-Fried Lawyers May Already Be Angling for an Appeal, Says Former Prosecutor
entry.summary: Judge Kaplan called the defense’s repetitive cross-examination into question several times last week.

entry.title: ‘Ukuhumusha’—A New Way to Hack OpenAI's ChatGPT
entry.summary: Researchers have discovered OpenAI's GPT-4’s security settings are ill-equipped to handle languages not commonly fed into its training data.

entry.title: Why NFL Alumni Are Turning to NFTs to Support Retired Football Players
entry.summary: The NFL Alumni Association is teaming with Aventus to help veteran players launch NFTs via Polkadot, with the aim of supporting former pros.

entry.title: Inside Shrapnel's Marketplace, New Map, and 'AI Director' Feature
entry.summary: Decrypt's Kate Irwin chats with Shrapnel's Head of Studio Don Norbury to get the latest updates on how the NFT-powered first-person sci-fi extraction shooter's development is progressing.

entry.title: 'Art of the Times': Art Blocks Founder Erick Calderon on the State of Generative Art
entry.summary: Art Blocks founder and CEO Erick Calderon sat down with Sander Lutz, lead culture reporter at Decrypt's SCENE, at Art Blocks Marfa Weekend 2023. They discuss the evolution of the company and the generative art world, along with what draws art enthusiasts to be an active part of the community.

entry.title: Decrypt Learn: Digital Ownership Explained
entry.summary: One of the most powerful aspects of blockchain technology is its ability to provide us genuine ownership of our digital assets. This is called digital ownership. In this video, we’ll deep dive into digital ownership, why it matters, and how web3 makes owning digital assets like our social networks, music libraries, personal data, and beyond possible. Author: Clarissa Watson, Senior Writer at Consensys.

entry.title: Martin Shkreli on E/ACC and SBF in Prison
entry.summary: Reza Jafery and Martin Shkreli sit down for a casual conversation about the growing movement that is E/ACC, what songs they could recite at gunpoint, and whether or not SBF will thrive or just survive during his time in prison.

entry.title: What Can AI Do in Gaming?
entry.summary: AI Arena CEO Brandon Da Silva and COO Wei Xie discuss how artificial intelligence can shape the video game experience.

entry.title: 'There Are No Real Standards': Ready Player Me CEO Timmu Tõke on Building for an Open Gaming Ecosystem
entry.summary: Timmu Tõke, co-founder and CEO of Ready Player Me, joins Decrypt contributor Ryan Gladwin to discuss the startup's approach to powering avatars that are interoperable across games and metaverse platforms—and what's needed to convince the industry to adopt standards and open up.

entry.title: Blockchain Is 'Only Way' Forward for Gaming, Says Shrapnel Studio Head
entry.summary: Shrapnel Studio Head Don Norbury tells Kate Irwin the reasons why the upcoming first-person shooter game will offer a wide range of NFTs. He also reveals team-based gameplay plans and shares how game maps have already changed this year.

entry.title: Social Media Sentiment Is Key to Crypto Price Discovery
entry.summary: Sacha Ghebali, Director of Strategy and Business Development at The TIE, says social media sentiment remains a key factor in price movements for major cryptocurrencies like Bitcoin and Ethereum. However, he notes that sentiment has turned more negative lately amid regulatory uncertainty. Ghebali believes events like the Ripple lawsuit ruling significantly impacted sentiment and prices. André Beganski interviewed him at Messari Mainnet.

entry.title: 500Altcoins discusses DeFi Summer and the Dubai Crypto Scene - This Time Will Be Different - Episode 2
entry.summary: Our host Reza Jafery is joined by Gareth Fenney aka 500Altcoins. They discuss the glory days of DeFi Summer and whether or not its a smart move for builders in the crypto space to relocate to Dubai.

entry.title: Decentralize Derivatives Trading with Custom Blockchain
entry.summary: David Gogel of dYdX discusses how the decentralized exchange is building a custom blockchain to fully decentralize derivatives trading. He explained how the new dYdX chain will allow validators to run order books in memory, enabling decentralized order matching at scale. This shift aims to increase security and transparency for traders while maintaining the performance of centralized exchanges.

entry.title: Crypto Accounting Challenges and Opportunities
entry.summary: As crypto matures, accounting and tax regulations are evolving. Amy Kalnoki of Bitwave explains how her company helps crypto companies properly account for digital assets. She notes the importance of flexibility as new crypto assets emerge and regulations change. Stacy Elliott interviewed her at Messari Mainnet 2023.

entry.title: Most Crypto Users Don't Trust Themselves to Keep Their Seed Phrase Safe: Ledger CEO
entry.summary: Decrypt's Stacy Elliott sat down with Ledger CEO Pascal Gauthier to discuss crypto custody post-FTX, and the hardware wallet manufacturer's controversial Ledger Recover service.

entry.title: India's 1% Crypto Tax Has Been a Nightmare for High-Frequency Traders, Says Shardeum CEO
entry.summary: As India figures out its regulatory approach to the crypto industry, one thing is clear to Shardeum co-founder Nischal Shetty: “If you're a high-frequency trader, you can't afford to lose a percentage every time you sell,” he told Decrypt's Andre Beganski at Messari Mainnet in New York. “That's something that's caused a lot of issues.”

entry.title: Newly Partnered with Visa, Solana Focuses on Reliability
entry.summary: Solana has improved network reliability through upgrades like Quick and local fee markets. It recently partnered with Visa to allow settling transactions in USDC on Solana. This could enable merchants to receive instant payments and save on credit card processing fees. Stacy Elliott spoke with Austin Federa, Head of Strategy for the Solana Foundation, at Messari Mainnet 2023.

entry.title: We Need to Start Thinking About How we Make Crypto Easy to Use: Robinhood Crypto General Manager
entry.summary: Decrypt's Stacy Elliott sat down with Robinhood Crypto general manager Johann Kerbrat at Messari Mainnet 2023, to talk about the trading platform's crypto wallet, onboarding new users through simplicity, and keeping platform fees sustainable.

entry.title: Bitcoin's Narrative Is Shifting Towards Layer-2 Solutions
entry.summary: Rich Rines, original Core DAO contributor and former Coinbase engineer, discusses how the narrative around Bitcoin is shifting in 2023. While Bitcoin remains digital gold, new layer 2 solutions are emerging to unlock more utility and value from the huge amounts of capital stored in Bitcoin. He says these innovations can benefit Bitcoin holders while keeping Bitcoin maximalists happy by building outside the base layer. André Beganski interviewed him at Messari Mainnet 2023.

entry.title: Regulation Threatens U.S. Dominance of Financial Markets, Says CoinRoutes CEO
entry.summary: Dave Weisberger, Co-Founder and CEO of CoinRoutes, argued that excessive regulation in the U.S. threatens to undermine the country's long-standing dominance in global financial markets. He warned that other countries are embracing blockchain and crypto to build more efficient digital markets, which could cause the US to lose its competitive edge and trillions in GDP. Weisberger said CoinRoutes is now focusing more on expanding internationally due to restrictive policies in the U.S. He was interviewed by André Beganski of Decrypt at Messari Mainnet 2023.

entry.title: Explosive Growth Ahead for Enterprise Blockchain
entry.summary: Paul Brody drives Ernst & Young (EY) initiatives and investments in blockchain technology across consulting, audit, and tax business lines. He says enterprise blockchain adoption is nearing an inflection point. Brody believes blockchains will one day handle 40 billion transactions daily across industries like automotive and pharma. Stacy Elliott interviewed him at Messari Mainnet 2023.

entry.title: Building a Developer-Friendly zkRollup to Scale Ethereum
entry.summary: Daniel Helm, head of Developer Relations at Scroll, discussess how they are building a zkRollup to scale Ethereum transactions and lower fees. He explained their focus on creating a seamless developer experience by maintaining Ethereum's ethos and tooling. Scroll aims to launch their mainnet soon, providing more scalable blockspace for Ethereum developers. Stacy Elliott of Decrypt interviewed him at Messari Mainnet 2023.
